Column Comment.0: LITHOLOGY LOG ID: A unique identifier for a descriptive record of lithology.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: DEPTH OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for the depth interval for this lithinterval. Use LITH LOG to get the top and base depths.
Column Comment.3: LITHOLOGIC ROCK TYPE: Type of rock comprising a significant portion of theinterval. For example, the predominant rock type in the interval may be coal, or ooliticlimestone or calcareous sandstone.
Column Comment.4: ROCK TYPE OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique sequence number enablingstorage of multiple descriptions for descriptive logs.
Column Comment.5: LITHOLOGIC SCALE SCHEME: Type of scaling system source used to determinethe grain size like the widely accepted Wentworth scale, or a company internal gradescale (Canstrat, Shell).
Column Comment.6: LITHOLOGIC GRAIN SIZE: Size of the measured grain or crystal particle, measuredeither in Wentworth nomenclature like, Boulder, Pebble, Fine sand, Silt, or the actualmeasurement like, 0.5mm, 4.0 mm, etc.
Column Comment.7: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.8: DISTRIBUTION INDICATOR: Letter indicating grain or crystal size distribution, eitherY for mode or N for range.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SIZE TYPE INDICATOR: Indicator for the grain size, either carbonate or siliciclastic.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
